meanings.definition: To bargain or negotiate over a price.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys haggling at the market for better deals.
meanings.sent2: Customers often haggle with sellers to get a lower price.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were haggling playfully over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players haggle with each other to trade resources.
meanings.sent5: The image of the two friends haggling over a toy car stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: The act of arguing or disputing over a price.
meanings.sent1: The haggling between the two vendors could be heard across the street.
meanings.sent2: There was a lot of haggling at the flea market over antique items.
meanings.sent3: The haggling between the siblings for the last piece of cake was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The constant haggling in the office over project budgets was exhausting.
meanings.sent5: The haggling at the auction made the event more exciting and competitive.
